title: Project Template & Coding Agent Selection
description: Enable template/agent selection in sl new with 7 templates, 3 agents, UUID generation. Metadata schema v1.0.0 → v1.1.0 with project.id (UUID), project.template, project.agent fields. Creates .claude/ or .opencode/ directories based on agent selection.

title: Phase 1: Setup
description: Project initialization and dependency setup. Creates pkg/models structure, adds UUID dependency, updates .gitignore.

title: Add github.com/google/uuid dependency
description: Need UUID generation capability for unique project IDs (FR-005). Add github.com/google/uuid v1.6.0 to go.mod using go get.
design: Add github.com/google/uuid v1.6.0 to go.mod using go get. Verify YAML marshaling works with uuid.UUID type.
acceptance_criteria: go.mod contains uuid dependency, go mod tidy succeeds, import works in test file

title: Create pkg/models directory structure
description: Need centralized location for data models (TemplateDefinition, AgentConfig). Create pkg/models/ directory with .gitkeep or README.
design: Create pkg/models/ directory. Add .gitkeep or README explaining purpose.
acceptance_criteria: pkg/models/ directory exists, can create .go files within it

title: Update .gitignore for development artifacts
description: Ensure build artifacts, test files, and IDE files are ignored during development.
design: Review .gitignore, add patterns: *.test, *.out, .DS_Store, .idea/, .vscode/. Preserve existing patterns.
acceptance_criteria: Common development artifacts don't appear in git status

title: Phase 10: Polish & Cross-Cutting
description: Integration tests, documentation, error handling, and quality improvements across all features.

title: Create integration tests for all template types
description: Need test coverage for all 7 template creations (SC-002, SC-006). Verify key directories and files for each template.
design: Create tests/integration/templates_test.go. Table-driven test for all 7 templates: verify key directories, starter files, metadata.
acceptance_criteria: All 7 templates tested, key directories verified, tests pass

title: Run final integration test suite
description: Need comprehensive test run verifying all success criteria (SC-001 through SC-012). Run full test suite, verify performance.
design: Run go test ./... -v. Verify all 12 success criteria. Create test script for repeatable verification.
acceptance_criteria: All tests pass, all success criteria verified, no regressions

title: Create integration tests for all agent configs
description: Need test coverage for all 3 agent configurations (SC-007). Verify .claude/, .opencode/, or none.
design: Create tests/integration/agents_test.go. Table-driven test for all 3 agents: verify correct directories and config files.
acceptance_criteria: All 3 agents tested, config directories verified, tests pass

title: Add TUI navigation tests
description: Need unit tests for TUI step navigation (SC-001). Test arrow keys, wraparound, confirmation.
design: Create pkg/cli/tui/sl_new_test.go. Test Model.Update() for template and agent navigation.
acceptance_criteria: Navigation tests pass, wraparound verified, selection confirmed

title: Add --force flag documentation and implementation
description: Need --force flag for directory overwrite (FR-026). Delete and recreate existing directory.
design: Add --force flag. In bootstrap, check if directory exists. If exists && !force, error. If exists && force, os.RemoveAll then create fresh.
acceptance_criteria: --force deletes and recreates, without flag shows error if directory exists

title: Enforce template immutability
description: Need to prevent template changes after creation (FR-027, SC-011). Document immutability, no change command.
design: Add comment in schema.go stating Template field immutable. Document in README. No template change command.
acceptance_criteria: Documentation states template immutable, no template change command exists

title: Add error handling for agent config copy failures
description: Need graceful handling of agent config failures. Log warnings but continue project creation.
design: Wrap agent config file operations in error handling. Log warning on failure but continue (non-fatal).
acceptance_criteria: Agent config failures logged but don't abort project creation

title: Update AGENTS.md template for all templates
description: Need AGENTS.md context file for each template explaining structure. Create/update for all 7 templates.
design: Create AGENTS.md for all 7 templates with: description, tech stack, directory structure, dev commands, testing. Consistent format.
acceptance_criteria: All 7 templates have AGENTS.md, content explains structure, consistent format

title: Update command help text for new flags
description: Need clear help text for all new flags. Update sl new --help with examples.
design: Update sl new command help text. Document --template, --agent, --list-templates, --force. Add examples.
acceptance_criteria: sl new --help shows clear flag descriptions with examples

title: Create quickstart.md developer guide
description: Need developer guide for extending templates and TUI. How to add templates, add TUI steps, testing patterns.
design: Create specledger/593-init-project-templates/quickstart.md with: add template instructions, extend TUI, testing, troubleshooting.
acceptance_criteria: Quickstart.md provides step-by-step guide for common developer tasks

title: Phase 2: Foundational
description: Core infrastructure that MUST complete before ANY user story implementation. Creates TemplateDefinition, AgentConfig models, extends metadata schema to v1.1.0, implements migration, updates manifest structure.

title: Create TemplateDefinition model struct
description: Need data structure to represent project templates with metadata (FR-001, FR-002). Define struct with ID, Name, Description, Characteristics, Path, IsDefault fields. Add Validate() and String() methods.
design: Create pkg/models/template.go with struct: ID (string), Name (string), Description (string), Characteristics ([]string), Path (string), IsDefault (bool). Add Validate() checking kebab-case ID, name length 1-50 chars, description 1-200 chars, max 6 characteristics.
acceptance_criteria: TemplateDefinition struct defined, Validate() rejects invalid templates, String() formats correctly

title: Create AgentConfig model struct
description: Need data structure for agent configurations (FR-004). Define struct with ID, Name, Description, ConfigDir. Add SupportedAgents(), GetAgentByID(), DefaultAgent() methods.
design: Create pkg/models/agent.go with struct: ID, Name, Description, ConfigDir. Add HasConfig() method. SupportedAgents() returns 3 hardcoded agents: claude-code, opencode, none.
acceptance_criteria: AgentConfig struct defined, SupportedAgents() returns 3 options, GetAgentByID() validates IDs

title: Extend ProjectMetadata schema to v1.1.0
description: Need to store project UUID, template, and agent in metadata (FR-006, FR-007, FR-008, FR-009). Add ProjectInfo.ID (uuid.UUID), Template (string), Agent (string). Bump MetadataVersion to 1.1.0.
design: Modify pkg/cli/metadata/schema.go. Add fields to ProjectInfo: ID (uuid.UUID yaml:"id"), Template (string yaml:"template,omitempty"), Agent (string yaml:"agent,omitempty"). Update Validate() to check ID != uuid.Nil. Update NewProjectMetadata() to generate UUID with uuid.New().
acceptance_criteria: ProjectInfo has 3 new fields, Validate() requires UUID, new projects get auto-generated UUIDs

title: Implement metadata migration v1.0.0 → v1.1.0
description: Need to migrate existing v1.0.0 projects without breaking them (FR-023). Auto-generate UUID for old projects on load.
design: In Load() function after unmarshal: if metadata.Version == "1.0.0" && metadata.Project.ID == uuid.Nil, generate new UUID, set version = "1.1.0", save metadata.
acceptance_criteria: Loading v1.0.0 metadata auto-generates UUID, updates version, saves successfully

title: Update manifest.yaml structure for templates
description: Need manifest format supporting template metadata (FR-001). Change from flat playbooks list to include id, name, description, characteristics[], path, is_default.
design: Modify pkg/embedded/templates/manifest.yaml. Add template metadata fields: id, name, description, characteristics[], path, is_default. Update embedded.go parsing if needed.
acceptance_criteria: Manifest parses with template metadata, LoadTemplates() returns TemplateDefinition objects

title: Create template loader in playbooks package
description: Need function to load templates from embedded manifest. Add LoadTemplates() function that reads manifest.yaml, validates templates, returns slice.
design: Add LoadTemplates() ([]models.TemplateDefinition, error) to pkg/cli/playbooks/templates.go. Read manifest.yaml from TemplatesFS, unmarshal, validate each template, return slice. Cache results.
acceptance_criteria: LoadTemplates() returns all templates from manifest, validates each, handles errors gracefully

title: Phase 3: Template Selection (US1-P1)
description: Interactive template selection from 7 options with TUI navigation, view rendering, and confirmation. Creates template directory structures.

title: Add stepTemplate constant to TUI
description: Need new TUI step for template selection (FR-003). Add stepTemplate constant after stepShortCode, update step flow.
design: Modify pkg/cli/tui/sl_new.go. Add stepTemplate constant after stepShortCode. Update step order and renumber subsequent steps.
acceptance_criteria: stepTemplate constant exists, step order correct, TUI flow progresses through new step

title: Add template state to TUI Model struct
description: Need to store template selection state. Add templates []models.TemplateDefinition and selectedTemplateIndex int to Model.
design: Modify Model struct with templates and selectedTemplateIndex fields. Initialize templates in InitialModel() by calling playbooks.LoadTemplates().
acceptance_criteria: Model stores template list and selection index, InitialModel() populates templates

title: Implement template selection View rendering
description: Need to display template options with descriptions (FR-002, SC-001). Render cursor, radio buttons, names, descriptions, tech characteristics.
design: Add viewTemplateSelection() method. Render each template with cursor, radio button, name (bold if selected), description, characteristics. Use lipgloss styling.
acceptance_criteria: Template list displays with names, descriptions, tech tags, correct styling, cursor navigation

title: Implement template selection Update navigation
description: Need arrow key navigation through templates (FR-003). Handle up/down keys with wraparound.
design: In Update() case stepTemplate: handle up/down keys with wraparound navigation through templates.
acceptance_criteria: Up/down arrows move selection, wraps at boundaries, visual feedback immediate

title: Implement template selection confirmation
description: Need Enter key to confirm template selection (FR-007). Store template ID in answers map.
design: Handle Enter key: store templates[selectedTemplateIndex].ID in m.answers["template"], validate, advance to next step.
acceptance_criteria: Enter stores template ID in answers, advances to next step, invalid index handled safely

title: Add template selection to confirmation review
description: Need to display selected template in final confirmation screen. Show template name between short code and playbook/agent.
design: Modify confirmation view to show template selection. Look up template name from ID.
acceptance_criteria: Confirmation screen shows template selection, name displayed correctly

title: Create 7 template directory structures
description: Need actual template directories with starter files (FR-010, SC-002). Create general-purpose, full-stack, batch-data, realtime-workflow, ml-image, realtime-data, ai-chatbot.
design: Create directories in pkg/embedded/templates/ for all 7 templates with README.md, .gitignore, starter files. Update manifest.yaml.
acceptance_criteria: All 7 template directories exist with complete structure, manifest lists all, embedded correctly

title: Add structured logging for template selection
description: Need logging for template operations (FR-028, SC-012). Log template list loaded, selection, validation.
design: Add log/slog logging in template flow. Use structured fields: slog.Info("template selected", "id", templateID, "name", templateName).
acceptance_criteria: Template operations logged with structured fields, logs include relevant context

title: Phase 4: Agent Configuration (US2-P1)
description: Agent selection (Claude Code, OpenCode, None) with config directory creation and metadata storage.

title: Add stepAgent constant to TUI
description: Need TUI step for agent selection (FR-004). Add stepAgent constant, agents state, selectedAgentIndex.
design: Add stepAgent constant after stepTemplate. Update Model with agents []models.AgentConfig, selectedAgentIndex int. Initialize with SupportedAgents().
acceptance_criteria: stepAgent constant exists, agent state in Model, agents list populated with 3 options

title: Implement agent selection View and Update
description: Need agent selection UI with navigation. Display 3 agents with cursor, radio buttons, descriptions.
design: Add viewAgentSelection() rendering 3 agents. In Update() handle up/down keys, Enter confirms selection.
acceptance_criteria: 3 agents displayed, navigation works, Enter confirms selection

title: Implement agent config directory creation
description: Need to create agent-specific directories (FR-011, FR-012, FR-015). Claude Code creates .claude/, OpenCode creates .opencode/, None creates nothing.
design: Modify bootstrap.go: read m.answers["agent"], get agent via GetAgentByID(), create ConfigDir if HasConfig() true. Copy agent template files.
acceptance_criteria: Claude Code creates .claude/, OpenCode creates .opencode/, None creates nothing

title: Create OpenCode config template structure
description: Need OpenCode configuration files to copy (FR-012). Create .opencode/commands/, .opencode/skills/, opencode.json template.
design: Create pkg/embedded/templates/agents/opencode/ with .opencode/commands/, .opencode/skills/, opencode.json, AGENTS.md template.
acceptance_criteria: OpenCode template exists with all required files, copies correctly to project

title: Store agent selection in metadata
description: Need to record agent choice in specledger.yaml (FR-008, SC-007). Set metadata.Project.Agent = agentID before saving.
design: In bootstrap.go, set metadata.Project.Agent = agentID after reading m.answers["agent"]. Validate against known agents.
acceptance_criteria: specledger.yaml contains correct agent field, validates known agents only

title: Phase 5: UUID Generation (US3-P1)
description: Generate unique UUID v4 for each project, validate presence, document purpose.

title: Generate UUID in NewProjectMetadata
description: Need automatic UUID generation for new projects (FR-005, FR-006). Call uuid.New() in NewProjectMetadata().
design: Modify pkg/cli/metadata/yaml.go NewProjectMetadata(): set Project.ID = uuid.New(). UUID is cryptographically random.
acceptance_criteria: New projects get UUID automatically, UUID is cryptographically random, no collisions

title: Add UUID validation
description: Need to validate UUID presence on metadata load. v1.1.0 requires non-nil UUID.
design: In Validate(): if m.Version == "1.1.0" && m.Project.ID == uuid.Nil, return error. Allow nil for v1.0.0.
acceptance_criteria: v1.1.0 metadata requires UUID, validation rejects nil UUIDs, v1.0.0 allowed

title: Verify UUID uniqueness
description: Need test ensuring UUID collision probability is negligible (SC-005). Generate 10,000 UUIDs, verify uniqueness.
design: Create test: generate 10,000 UUIDs with uuid.New(), store in map, verify no duplicates. Test YAML round-trip.
acceptance_criteria: 10,000 UUIDs all unique, YAML round-trip preserves UUID value

title: Document UUID purpose in metadata schema
description: Need documentation explaining UUID field purpose. Add Go doc comment to ProjectInfo.ID.
design: Add doc comment: "ID is a unique project identifier (UUID v4) used to organize sessions in Supabase storage. Auto-generated on project creation, never changes."
acceptance_criteria: ID field has clear doc comment explaining purpose and lifecycle

title: Phase 6: Backward Compatibility (US6-P1)
description: Default selections produce identical output to current sl new. Auto-migrate v1.0.0 projects to v1.1.0.

title: Set default template to general-purpose
description: Need General Purpose template as default (FR-022, SC-003). Set is_default: true in manifest, pre-select in TUI.
design: In manifest.yaml, set is_default: true for general-purpose. In InitialModel(), find default template and select it.
acceptance_criteria: General Purpose pre-selected, matches current sl new structure exactly

title: Test backward compatibility of default flow
description: Need automated test verifying defaults match current behavior (SC-003). Compare directory structure to baseline.
design: Create integration test: create project with defaults, compare to baseline snapshot (current sl new). Ignore new metadata fields.
acceptance_criteria: Test passes, directory structure identical to current sl new (excluding metadata)

title: Implement and test v1.0.0 → v1.1.0 migration
description: Need to verify old projects migrate correctly (FR-023, SC-009). Test UUID generation, version update, data preservation.
design: Create integration test: save v1.0.0 specledger.yaml, call Load(), verify ID generated, version updated, data preserved, migration idempotent.
acceptance_criteria: v1.0.0 projects load, get UUID, update to v1.1.0, no data loss, idempotent

title: Phase 7: Non-Interactive Mode (US4-P2)
description: CLI flags (--template, --agent) for CI/CD automation. TTY detection and validation.

title: Add --template and --agent CLI flags
description: Need CLI flags for non-interactive mode (FR-016, FR-017). Add --template and --agent string flags to sl new command.
design: Modify sl new command: add flags --template string and --agent string. Register with cobra.
acceptance_criteria: Flags accepted by CLI, values accessible in command handler

title: Implement TTY detection and flag validation
description: Need to require flags in non-TTY environment (FR-021). Check if stdin is TTY, require flags if not.
design: Use isatty or terminal.IsTerminal to check TTY. If !isatty && flags empty, return error requiring flags.
acceptance_criteria: Non-TTY requires flags, TTY allows interactive, error messages clear

title: Validate template and agent flag values
description: Need to reject invalid template/agent IDs (FR-019, FR-020). Validate against LoadTemplates() and GetAgentByID().
design: If flags provided, validate values against available templates/agents. Return error listing valid options if invalid.
acceptance_criteria: Invalid IDs rejected with helpful error, valid options listed, exit code non-zero

title: Bypass TUI when flags provided
description: Need to skip TUI and use flag values directly (SC-004). Build answers map from flags, pass to bootstrap.
design: If template and agent flags provided and valid, build answers map directly, skip TUI, call bootstrap.
acceptance_criteria: Flags bypass TUI, project created immediately, output matches interactive mode

title: Phase 8: List Templates (US5-P2)
description: Discovery flag --list-templates showing all available templates with descriptions and tech tags.

title: Add --list-templates flag
description: Need discovery flag for available templates (FR-018). Add --list-templates bool flag to sl new command.
design: Add flag to sl new: cmd.Flags().Bool("list-templates", false, "List available project templates"). If true, call LoadTemplates(), display, exit 0.
acceptance_criteria: Flag recognized, triggers template listing, exits without creating project

title: Format and display template list
description: Need formatted output showing template details (SC-010). Display all 7 templates with IDs, descriptions, tech tags.
design: Format output: ID, name, description, tech tags for each template. Mark default with " (default)" suffix. Add usage instructions. Performance <100ms.
acceptance_criteria: All 7 templates listed, default marked, descriptions shown, tech tags included, <100ms

title: Phase 9: Claude Code Settings (US7-P2)
description: Auto-configure .claude/settings.json with session capture hooks for Claude Code selection.

title: Create .claude/settings.json template
description: Need settings template with session capture config (FR-013). Create JSON template with PostToolUse hook for Bash.
design: Create pkg/embedded/templates/agents/claude/settings.json with saveTranscripts: true, PostToolUse hook triggering "sl session capture" on Bash tool.
acceptance_criteria: Template JSON valid, includes session capture hook, copies to .claude/ directory

title: Copy settings.json when Claude Code selected
description: Need to install settings.json during project creation (FR-014, SC-008). Copy from template when agent.ID == "claude-code".
design: In bootstrap agent config creation, if agent.ID == "claude-code", copy settings.json to .claude/settings.json with 0644 permissions.
acceptance_criteria: settings.json appears in .claude/ when Claude Code selected, not for other agents

title: Document session capture integration
description: Need documentation explaining session capture auto-configuration. Add comment to settings.json and template README.
design: Add comment to settings.json explaining hook. Update template README: "This project uses Claude Code with automatic session capture."
acceptance_criteria: Documentation explains session capture, developers understand auto-configuration
